subject: RE: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse
msgSnippet: Bill, I ve recently set up a similar sort of project in Eclipse. What I wound up doing was having to create two separate Eclipse projects, one for the Java
messageBody:
Bill,

I've recently set up a similar sort of project in Eclipse. What I
wound up doing was having to create two separate Eclipse projects, one for
the Java subfolder, and one for the test subfolder, then putting a
dependency on the java project from the test project.

Of course, if you have any build files or anything up in the root
directory they won't be included in either...

Hope this helps,

-tim

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill de hÓra [mailto:dehora@...]
Sent: Wednesday, November 13, 2002 12:59 PM
To: junit
Subject: [junit] parallel test directories and eclipse


Hi,

Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
whose junit code is organized as follows:

src/
java/
a/b/c
test/
a/b/c

I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
in src/java

Bill de hÓra
